title: Commissioni riunite Cultura e Trasporti della Camera (2.12.2025) - Radio Radicale
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign
snippet: A podcast episode in which Fabio Giglietto (Associate Professor, University of Urbino) speaks about methods to detect coordinated disinformation campaigns on platforms like Facebook and Twitter.
description: A podcast episode from mediaecosystems.org features Fabio Giglietto, Associate Professor at the University of Urbino, discussing methods for detecting coordinated disinformation campaigns on social media platforms.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking
snippet: Press coverage of a project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto (University of Urbino) presenting results on the persistence of misinformation in spite of fact‑checking, showcased at the DMI Winter School in Amsterdam.
description: This press coverage from vera.ai discusses a project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto, professor at the University of Urbino, focusing on the persistence of misinformation despite fact-checking, presented at the DMI Winter School in Amsterdam.

title: Facebook accidentally gave misinformation about misinformation to researchers
snippet: The Independent covers how a social media researcher from the University of Urbino, Fabio Giglietto, revealed that Facebook’s data to researchers was incomplete, including only about half of U.S. users.
description: The article from The Independent discusses how Fabio Giglietto, a social media researcher from the University of Urbino, found that Facebook provided incomplete data to researchers regarding misinformation on its platform.

title: Facebook has been giving misinformation researchers incomplete data
snippet: The article reports that Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, was the first to discover that Facebook was providing flawed and incomplete interaction data to misinformation researchers by comparing it with the publicly released 'Widely Viewed Content Report.'
description: The Engadget article reports that Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor at the University of Urbino, discovered that Facebook provided flawed and incomplete interaction data to misinformation researchers.
